snippet: Edward J. Snowden, a former National Security Agency contractor who received temporary asylum in Russia, will start work on Friday at an Internet company, a lawyer said.
abstract: Interviews with those who have met Edward J Snowden provide clues to his unintended life in Russia, as he struggles to make a new home there after being granted temporary asylum; his lawyer, Anatoly G Kucherena, reports that Snowden has agreed to take a job with one of the country's major Internet companies.

byline.contributor: Andrew Roth and Nikolay Khalip contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Edward J. Snowden, a former National Security Agency contractor who received temporary asylum in Russia, will start work on Friday at an Internet company, a lawyer said.

headline.main: In Shadows, Hints of a Life and Even a Job for Snowden
headline.print_headline: In Shadows, Hints of a Life For Snowden
